coloradocollege.ifroning
Class Activator

java.lang.Object
  coloradocollege.ifroning.Activator

public class Activator
extends java.lang.Object

An activator is any object that the player can interact with that is not an item.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ian Froning

Constructor Summary
Activator()
          Constructs an empty activator.

          Constructs an activator with a given initial state, altered state, change message and key item.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String changeState(Key aKeyItem, Player thePlayer)
          Changes the state to the altered state and returns the new description.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Gets the activator's name.
 java.lang.String getState()
          Gets the description of the activator's state as the player will see it as they enter the room that contains it.

          Returns true if the activator is in its altered state.

Constructor Detail

Activator

public Activator()
Constructs an empty activator.

Activator

public Activator(java.lang.String aName,
                 java.lang.String anInitialState,
                 java.lang.String anActivatedState,
                 java.lang.String aChangeMessage,
                 Key aKeyItem)
Constructs an activator with a given initial state, altered state, change message and key item. The state is set to the initial state.

Parameters:
aName - the name
anInitialState - the initial state
anActivatedState - the activated state (make sure this is not the same as the initial state or the game won't be able to tell the two apart)
aChangeMessage - the message displayed when the activator is changed to its altered state
keyItem - the key item

Gets the activator's name.

Returns:

getState

public java.lang.String getState()
Gets the description of the activator's state as the player will see it as they enter the room that contains it.

Returns:
the description

isActivated

public boolean isActivated()
Returns true if the activator is in its altered state.

Returns:
true if the activator is in its altered state

changeState

public java.lang.String changeState(Key aKeyItem,
                                    Player thePlayer)
Changes the state to the altered state and returns the new description.

Returns:
the description of the new state
